document.docAuthor: Kluge, Nikita J., Gattolliat, Jean-Luc, Salles, Frederico F. & Novikova, Eugenia A.
document.docTitle: Susua niandanensis Wuillot in Wuillot & Gillies 1993
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Afrotropical genus Susua Lugo-Ortiz & McCafferty 1998 (Ephemeroptera: Baetidae: Protopatellata)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Afrotropical genus Susua Lugo-Ortiz & McCafferty 1998 (Ephemeroptera: Baetidae: Protopatellata)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Afroptilum niandanensis Wuillot in Wuillot & Gillies 1993b : 272
( ♂ imago and larva).

Material examined. Topotypes: GUINEA , Niger , Sassambaya, Niandan, 23.XII.1984 , coll. J.-M. Elouard: 13 larvae (QR code GBIFCH00238432); same locality and collector, 23.XII.1985 : 13 larvae (QR code GBIFCH00238437); 19.IV.1986 : 30 larvae (QR code GBIFCH00238439); 6.IV.1988 : 3 larvae (QR code GBIFCH00238436). Other localities: MALI , Sénégal , Missira, Baoule, 08.XI.1984 , coll. J.-M. Elouard: 1 larva (QR code GBIFCH00238434). SENEGAL , Gambia , Mako, Gambia , 26.I.1989 , coll. J.-M. Elouard: 2 larvae (QR code GBIFCH00238431).
CÔTE D'IVOIRE
: Cavally, Tai, Cavally, 10.II.1988 , coll. J.-M. Elouard: 6 I ♂ (QR code GBIFCH00238435); Cavally, Tai, N'ze, 10.II.1988 , coll. J.-M. Elouard: 8 I ♂ (QR code GBIFCH00238433); Anoblekro, Soumié, 1.VII.2003 , coll. Edia Oi Edia: 1 larva (QR code GBIFCH00521576); Anoblekro, Soumié, 6.III.2005 , coll. Edia Oi Edia: 1 larva (QR code GBIFCH00521577). ZAMBIA : River West Lunga and River Mudanyama near Mwinilunga, 14–17.VIII.2014 , coll. N. Kluge & L. Sheyko: 1 L-S-I ♀ {number [XI](9)C}, 1 L/ S ♂ , 1 larva ( ZIN ); River Lwakela 22 km N Mwinilunga, 16–21.VIII.2014 , coll. N. Kluge & L. Sheyko: 1 L/S ♀ , 1 larva ( ZIN ); River Zambezi upstream Victoria Falls, 25–31.VIII.2014 , coll. N. Kluge & L. Sheyko: 2 larvae ( ZIN ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 62–68. Last instar larvae of
Susua niandanensis
from Zambia. 62, exuviae of labium; 63, base of labium with focus on ventral side; 64, the same with focus on dorsal side; 65, detached cuticle of mle head with labrum, mandibles and bases of antennae (with subimaginal antennae inside); 66, apex of maxilla (with focus on dentisetae and inner-dorsal row of setae); 67– 68, left and right mandibles. Abbreviation: d-l, dorso-lateral sclerite.

FIGURES 69–77.
Susua niandanensis
from Zambia. 69, labium (at left ventral view; at right dorsal view); 70, larval claw; 71, hind wing of female imago (interrupted line shows lost part of costal projection); 72–73, tergalii I–II; 74–76, tergalii V–VII; 77, paraproct.

FIGURES 78–86.
Susua niandanensis
from Zambia. 78–79, male larva of last instar; 80–81, exuviae of last instar female larva (80, right half of pronotum and mesonotum; 81, abdominal sterna, terga and caudalii); 82–84, parts of last instar male larva (8 2, pronotum and mesonotum; 83, metanotum; 84, abdomen); 85, subimaginal abdominal sterna and terga extracted from mature male larva; 86, abdominal terga and sterna of female imago (the same specimen as in Figs 80–81). Abbreviations: I–X, abdominal segments I–X.

FIGURES 87–90. Exuviae of left half of pronotum and mesonotum of last instar larva of
Susua niandanensis
from Zambia. 87, general view; 88, scales on pronotum; 89, scales on mesonotum; 90, scales on posterior part of fore protopteron.

FIGURES 91–96.
Susua niandanensis
. 91–92, hind femora of two specimens from Guinea (type locality); 93–95, exuviae of last instar larva from Zambia: 93, hind leg (black triangle shows point where patella-tibial suture crosses inner margin); 94, tergum V; 95, tergum VII; 96, sternum IX.

FIGURES 97–104.
Susua niandanensis
from Zambia. 97, folded subimaginal genital extracted from larva; 98, detail of 97 with focus on left gonovectis; 99–100, fore and middle legs of female imago; 101, subimaginal exuviae of right half of mesonotum; 102, subimaginal exuviae of left pleuron; 103–104, head and thorax of female imago. Abbreviations: gd, gonoduct; gv, gonovectis; m.gs, gonostylar muscle; m.gv, gonovectal muscle; m.s, styligeral muscle; pat, patella-tibial suture.

FIGURES 105–108.
Susua niandanensis
from Côte d’Ivoire. 105, fore and hind wings; 106, hind wing; 107, genitals of male imago, ventral view (gonovectes shown by interrupted lines); 108, penis of male imago with focus on right gonovectis and gonovectal muscle.

subSubSection.paragraph: RESPIRATORY MOVEMENTS. Larva makes rhythmical movements by tergalii of first pair (which are greatly enlarged—Fig. 72), while other tergalii do not make respiratory movements.

Subimago .
CUTICULAR COLORATION. Head colorless. Pronotum nearly colorless. Mesonotum nearly colorless, certain sutures brown ( Fig. 101 ). Thoracic pleura and sterna at most part nearly colorless, certain sclerites brown ( Fig. 102 ). Legs nearly colorless with brown microtrichia. Abdominal terga and sterna nearly colorless with brown microtrichia. Cerci colorless with brown spines.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 109–110. Egg of
Susua niandanensis
from Zambia.

FIGURES 111–114. Exuviae of larval pronotum of
Crassabwa
and its scales. 111–112,
C. flava
; 113–114,
C. ludmilae
.

subSubSection.paragraph: TEXTURE. On all legs of male and female all tarsomeres covered by pointed microlepides.

Gonostyli: 1 st segment elongate, 2nd segment widened apically, 3rd segment elongate and clavate ( Fig. 107 ; Wuillot & Gillies 1993 : Fig. 16 ). Each gonovectis apically pointed and shallowly bent S-like; proximally without projection, so gonovectal muscle attached directly to smooth margin of gonovectis ( Figs 98 , 108 ).
Eggs . Irregular oval, 0.15 mm length; chorion with irregular longitudinal ridges consisted of fused protuberances ( Figs 109–110 ).
Dimension. Fore wing length of examined female imago 5 mm ; according to Wuillot & Gillies (1993b) , fore wing length of male 3–4 mm .

Distribution. Afrotropical Region (known from Guinea , Senegal ,
Côte d'Ivoire
and Zambia )
